page.title: 14THE BLOCK WORKS
page.content: A very recent addition to this area is the English China Clay Companies block works which serves the whole of Cornwall. The works took 12 months to build and was opened in 1984. It is along side Milord's Road which runs from Fraddon to Scarcewater.The works covers 22 acres, 7 of which are tarmacadamed. It produces concrete blocks using the nearby waste China Clay sand brought in by 50 ton dumpers, cement in bulk tankers from the cement depot at Chacewater and mains water. The works are fully antomated requiring only 24 staff. It is basically a programme Logic control system which requires a process to be completed before the previous operation in a sequence of events can take place.Another innovation is that blocks are dried in kilns as a result of their own drying process.
